message: I have a high-quality product for sale for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 50% discount if you buy it now, but if you don't, the price will go back to $10000 for the next product. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at the discounted price.

However, I want to make it clear that the discount offer is only for the first product, and this one is sold at the full price. But, I'm willing to give you a 3-day money-back guarantee. If you're not satisfied with this product, I'll refund your money within 3 days. What do you say?
I'll buy the product with the 3-day money-back guarantee.

I want to be upfront with you - I've had some issues with this product's quality control, and I'm not as confident in its performance as I am with my usual products. However, I'm willing to sell it to you at a slightly lower price of $8000. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll throw in a free maintenance service to help you get the most out of it.
